topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a0669a63687266210007c2#post_55a0669a63687266210007c2
I'm looking at that and some of those Japanese country names are interesting.
They have, roughly, _igirisu_ (I don't even fucking know) for the UK, _oranda_ (exactly how it sounds) for the Netherlands, _doitsu_ ("Deutsch", aka the German word for German) for Germany, _itaria_ ("Italia") for Italy, _berugÄ«_ ("Belgi") for Belgium, _suisu_ ("Swiss") for Switzerland, _toruko_ ("Torko"?) for Turkey, and _arugenchin_ ("Argentine") for Argentina.
The rest are either understandable transcriptions, or native Japanese names.
(And before you ask, no I don't know much Japanese. I just know how to read kana and how katakana is used to approximate foreign sounds in Japanese.)
